sen.e: Kannon-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Chizan School of the Pure Land Sect located in Fugenji Shimodaimon, Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 奈良時代、法相宗の僧義淵により創建された観心山親山寺が始まりと伝えられ、天平年間（729年～748年）良弁が中興したという。
sen.e: The temple is said to have began as Kanshinzan Shinzan-ji Temple that was founded during the Nara period by Hosso Sect monk Gien before being revived by Ryoben during the Tenpyo era (729-748).

sen.e: It is reputed that Priest Jicchu of Ryoben's Todai-ji Temple was later appointed as the first head priest.

sen.j: たびたび火災に遭い藤原氏の援助によりその都度復興されたが、藤原氏の衰退とともに寺運も衰えた。
sen.e: The temple was damaged by fire on numerous occasions and each time was rebuilt with the assistance of the Fujiwara clan but the temple fell into ruin as the Fujiwara clan declined.
